text: Was a convenient extension. It was also free until recently. Paying $10 a month for more than 3 YouTube videos when it uses my own AI is really not happening. There are lots of alternatives and you can even do it without using an extension, it just takes a couple of extra clicks. The new Gemini also summarises videos automatically just from the YouTube url. F off, never using the extension again.

author: Leonardo Guia
text: I was unable to use this extension effectively. When clicking the button, I expected a summary option, even while watching a video. Instead, I was redirected to a page with numerous AI model options and prompt-related fields. Despite selecting a model and prompt, I couldn't find a 'summarize' button or a URL field to enter a video link. The user interface lacks clarity and intuitiveness, making it difficult to navigate. As a full-stack developer, I'm confident in my ability to use websites an...

author: Boris
text: I can't believe they are trying to charge $10/month to use this tools, it's more like a price for a lifetime purchase. I mean it's a good convenience ngl, but let us just list the services that are charging ~$10: spotify, netflix, apple music...So this \"team\" thinks their front-end simple parse-and-request automation tools will supply similar value compared to those daily/weekly updated streaming service not to mention they are not providing any AI platform api quotas or any computation pow...

author: D R
text: It's honestly mind-boggling that an app built to encourage and enhance the use of ChatGPT and the internet now thinks it's reasonable to charge $10 a month—on top of the countless other AI tools we're already paying for. This isn’t innovation; it’s exploitation. Let’s be real: replicating this app with no-code tools is child’s play at this point. So while I respect the effort you’ve put in as a small team and the initial momentum you created, this new pricing strategy is a slap in the face t...

1 star for turning a free tool into subscription-based bs with zero added value. No one expects this plugin to do anything more than just copy-paste a script into ChatGPT. Play with your paid features somewhere else and let this simple, straightforward tool be as it is.
